definition: (textiles) to scour/to degum (silk)/variant of 精煉|精炼[jing1 lian4]
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: The born weakness of vernacular poems is the unrefined language.
sentences.chinese: 白話詩語言欠精練，是與生俱來之病。

sentences.english: Terseness or succinctness of style or expression.
sentences.chinese: 簡潔精練或簡潔的表達風格。

sentences.english: The process of creating a design or illustration at later stages involves refinement.
sentences.chinese: 設計過程的最後階段離不開精練。

sentences.english: Traditional alkali scouring can be substituted by enzyme-based treatment.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，酶精練能夠代替鹼精練。

sentences.english: Traditional alkali scouring can be substituted by enzyme-based treatment.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，酶精練能夠代替鹼精練。

sentences.english: Its refined terminology and class distinctions are frequently meaningful for engineering work.
sentences.chinese: 其精練的名詞術語與分類特徵常常對工程是有意義的。

definition: to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
